column1: Between his apprehension and his trial no friend or kinsman had been allowed to visit him; but now that his death was assured
column2: greater license had been granted. But
column3: anxious to deprive his enemies of a chance to accuse his sons
column4: he had sent them his earnest entreaties and commands that they should abstain from using this permission until the night before his execution. They had obeyed; but obedience of this sort did not satisfy the conscience of his daughter Grizel. On the very night of his condemnation he heard the key turn in his door; thinking it could only be the gaoler
column5: he scarcely lifted his eyes. But the next moment a pair of soft arms were flung round his neck
column6: and his daughter was weeping on his breast. From that day she had continued to visit him; and now as she sat beside him
column7: staring at the light already fading in the narrow pane
column8: both father and daughter knew that it was almost the last time.
